docs.title: Dj Urls Panel
docs.text: Django admin URL introspection. Inspect, search, and understand your project's URL routing—directly from the admin.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Dj Urls Panel is a Django admin extension that provides a comprehensive interface for viewing and testing your Django URLs. It includes a Swagger-like testing interface, automatic Django REST Framework integration, and built-in security features.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• URL Visualization: View all Django URL patterns in an organized, searchable interface
  • Interactive Testing Interface: Swagger-like UI for testing URLs directly from the admin:
  • Test any HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, etc.)
  • Dynamic URL parameter input with validation
  • Configure headers and authentication (Bearer, Token, Basic, Session)
  • Request body editor with JSON formatting
  • Real-time response display
  • Automatic cURL command generation with copy functionality
  • DRF Integration: Automatic detection and visualization of Django REST Framework serializers
  • Security Features:
  • Built-in SSRF protection with configurable blocklist
  • Optional host whitelisting for production
  • Ability to disable testing interface entirely
  • Admin Panel Integration: Seamlessly integrated into Django Admin

docs.title: Quick Links
docs.text:
• ✨ Features - Explore all features with screenshots
  • 📦 Installation - Get started in minutes
  • ⚙️ Configuration - Customize for your needs
  • 🔧 Development - Contribute to the project

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Python 3.9+
  • Django 4.2+

docs.title: License
docs.text: MIT License - See LICENSE file for details.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: Dj Urls Panel currently works out of the box with minimal configuration.

docs.title: Basic Setup
docs.text:
The only required configuration is adding the app to your INSTALLED_APPS and including the URLs in your URL configuration.

See the Installation guide for setup instructions.

docs.title: URLs Configuration
docs.text:
# urls.py
urlpatterns = [
path('admin/dj-urls-panel/', include('dj_urls_panel.urls')),  # Custom path
path('admin/', admin.site.urls),
]

docs.title: Security
docs.text:
Dj Urls Panel uses Django's built-in admin authentication:

  • Only staff users (is_staff=True) can access the panel
  • All views require authentication via @staff_member_required
  • No additional security configuration needed

docs.title: Advanced Configuration
docs.text: Advanced configuration options will be added in future releases.

docs.title: Development
docs.text: Contributing to Dj Urls Panel or setting up for local development.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.9+
  • Git
  • Docker (recommended)

docs.title: 1. Clone Repository
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/yassi/dj-urls-panel.git
cd dj-urls-panel

docs.title: Option A: Docker (Recommended)
docs.text:
make docker_up       # Start all services
make docker_shell    # Open shell in container

docs.title: Option B: Local Environment
docs.text:
# Create virtual environment
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # Windows: venv\Scripts\activate
# Install package and dependencies
make install
# or
pip install -e .
pip install -r requirements.txt

docs.title: 3. Set Up Example Project
docs.text:
cd example_project
python manage.py migrate
python manage.py createsuperuser

docs.title: 4. Run Development Server
docs.text:
python manage.py runserver

Visit: http://127.0.0.1:8000/admin/

docs.title: Run All Tests
docs.text:
# Docker
make test_docker

# Local
make test_local

docs.title: Run Specific Tests
docs.text:
pytest tests/test_admin.py -v
pytest tests/test_admin.py::TestAdminIntegration::test_celery_panel_appears_in_admin_index

docs.title: With Coverage
docs.text: pytest --cov=dj_urls_panel tests/

docs.title: Project Structure
docs.text:
dj-urls-panel/
├── dj_urls_panel/          # Main package
│   ├── views.py              # Django views
│   ├── urls.py               # URL patterns
│   ├── models.py             # Placeholder model
│   ├── admin.py              # Admin integration
│   └── templates/            # HTML templates
├── tests/                    # Test suite
│   ├── base.py               # Test base class
│   ├── test_admin.py         # Admin integration tests
│   └── conftest.py           # Pytest configuration
├── example_project/          # Example Django project
├── docs/                     # Documentation
└── Makefile                  # Development commands

docs.title: Code Style
docs.text:
• Follow PEP 8
  • Use type hints where helpful
  • Write docstrings for public methods
  • Keep functions focused and small

docs.title: Makefile Commands
docs.text:
make install        # Install dependencies
make test_local     # Run tests locally
make test_docker    # Run tests in Docker
make docker_up      # Start Docker services
make docker_down    # Stop Docker services
make docker_shell   # Open shell in container

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
1. Fork the repository
  2. Create a feature branch
  3. Make your changes
  4. Add tests
  5. Run test suite
  6. Submit pull request

docs.title: Features
docs.text: Dj Urls Panel provides a comprehensive suite of tools for managing and testing Django URLs directly from the Django Admin interface.

docs.title: 🎯 URL Visualization
docs.text: View all Django URL patterns in an organized, searchable interface with detailed information about each endpoint.

docs.title: Key Capabilities
docs.text:
• Browse all registered URL patterns
  • Search and filter URLs by pattern, name, or view
  • View URL namespaces and organization
  • See HTTP methods supported by each endpoint
  • Access URL metadata and reversal examples

docs.title: 🧪 Interactive Testing Interface
docs.text: A Swagger-like interface for testing your URLs directly from the admin, without needing external tools like Postman or cURL.

docs.title: Testing Capabilities
docs.text:
• HTTP Method Selection: Choose from GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS
  • Dynamic URL Parameters: Automatically detect and fill URL parameters (e.g., <int:pk>, <uuid:id>)
  • Request Headers: Add custom headers for testing
  • Authentication Support:
  • Bearer Token
  • Token Authentication
  • Basic Auth
  • Session Authentication (use current session or specify session ID)
  • Request Body Editor: JSON formatting with syntax highlighting
  • Real-time Response Display: View status codes, headers, and response body
  • cURL Command Generation: Automatic generation with one-click copy

docs.title: Testing GET Requests
docs.text: Test GET requests with URL parameters, query strings, and custom headers.

docs.title: Testing POST/PUT/PATCH Requests
docs.text: Test write operations with a full-featured request body editor.

docs.title: 🔗 Django REST Framework Integration
docs.text: Automatic detection and visualization of DRF serializers, providing insights into your API structure.

docs.title: DRF Features
docs.text:
• Automatic Serializer Detection: Identifies serializers from ViewSets and APIViews
  • Field Information: Displays field names, types, and attributes
  • Required Fields: Highlights required vs optional fields
  • Read-Only Indicators: Shows which fields are read-only
  • Help Text: Displays field help text and validation rules

docs.title: 🔒 Security Features
docs.text: Built-in security measures to protect against Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) and other vulnerabilities.

docs.title: SSRF Protection
docs.text:
Default blocklist prevents testing against dangerous internal targets:

  • Localhost and loopback addresses (127.0.0.1, ::1)
  • Private IP ranges (10.x.x.x, 172.16-31.x.x, 192.168.x.x)
  • Link-local addresses (169.254.x.x - including cloud metadata endpoints)
  • IPv6 private addresses

docs.title: Host Whitelisting
docs.text:
Explicitly control which hosts can be tested:

DJ_URLS_PANEL_SETTINGS = {
'ALLOWED_HOSTS': ['example.com', 'api.example.com'],
}

When configured, ONLY whitelisted hosts are allowed.

docs.title: Disable Testing Interface
docs.text:
Completely disable the testing interface for production:

DJ_URLS_PANEL_SETTINGS = {
'ENABLE_TESTING': False,
}

When disabled, the testing interface is hidden and the execute endpoint returns 403.

docs.title: 📋 URL Metadata & Usage Examples
docs.text: Get detailed information about each URL and learn how to use it in your code.

docs.title: Metadata Information
docs.text:
• URL pattern and regex
  • View function/class details
  • URL name and namespace
  • Supported HTTP methods
  • URL parameters and types

docs.title: Usage Examples
docs.text:
Code examples showing how to use URLs in your Django views:

  • reverse() function examples
  • Template URL tag examples
  • Parameter handling examples

docs.title: ⚙️ Configuration Options
docs.text: Flexible configuration to adapt to your project needs.

docs.title: URL Filtering
docs.text:
Exclude specific URL patterns from the panel:

DJ_URLS_PANEL_SETTINGS = {
'EXCLUDE_URLS': [
r'^admin/',      # Exclude admin URLs
r'^__debug__/',  # Exclude debug toolbar
r'^api/internal/',  # Exclude internal APIs
],
}

docs.title: Custom URLconf
docs.text:
Use a different URLconf for the panel:

DJ_URLS_PANEL_SETTINGS = {
'URL_CONFIG': 'myproject.api_urls',
}

Useful for: - Displaying only API URLs - Testing different URL configurations - Separating documentation from main app

docs.title: 🎨 Admin Integration
docs.text: Seamlessly integrated into the Django Admin interface with a familiar look and feel.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Appears alongside your Django models in the admin
  • Uses Django admin styling for consistency
  • No additional migrations or models required
  • Works with custom admin themes
  • Responsive design for mobile testing

docs.title: 🚀 Performance
docs.text:
• Minimal overhead - only loads when accessed
  • Efficient URL pattern introspection
  • No database queries required
  • Fast search and filtering
  • Lightweight request execution

docs.title: 📖 Next Steps
docs.text:
• Installation Guide - Get started in minutes
  • Configuration - Customize for your needs
  • Development - Contribute to the project

docs.title: 1. Install the Package
docs.text: pip install dj-urls-panel

docs.title: 2. Add to Django Settings
docs.text:
Add dj_urls_panel to your INSTALLED_APPS:

INSTALLED_APPS = [
'django.contrib.admin',
'django.contrib.auth',
'django.contrib.contenttypes',
'django.contrib.sessions',
'django.contrib.messages',
'django.contrib.staticfiles',
'dj_urls_panel',  # Add this
# ... your other apps
]

docs.title: 3. Include URLs
docs.text:
Add the Panel URLs to your main urls.py:

from django.contrib import admin
from django.urls import path, include
urlpatterns = [
path('admin/dj-urls-panel/', include('dj_urls_panel.urls')),
path('admin/', admin.site.urls),
]

docs.title: 4. Run Migrations
docs.text: python manage.py migrate

docs.title: 5. Configure Settings (Optional)
docs.text:
For basic usage, no configuration is needed. For advanced features and security options:

# settings.py
DJ_URLS_PANEL_SETTINGS = {
# Exclude specific URL patterns
'EXCLUDE_URLS': [
r'^admin/',      # Exclude admin URLs
r'^__debug__/',  # Exclude debug toolbar
],
# Enable/disable URL testing interface
'ENABLE_TESTING': True,  # Set to False in production
# Whitelist hosts for URL testing (SSRF protection)
'ALLOWED_HOSTS': None,  # or ['yourdomain.com']
}

See Configuration for detailed options.

docs.title: 6. Access the Panel
docs.text:
1. Start your Django development server: 

    python manage.py runserver

  2. Navigate to http://127.0.0.1:8000/admin/

  3. Look for the "DJ URLS PANEL" section

That's it! You can now browse and test your URLs directly from the admin interface.
